timeline.bodyText:
I think you also write every mod record into tsfile resource's mod file. In jira, you said that
We need to record N*M modifications, which is time consuming. 

Could you explain that?   Thanks~
timeline.author: SilverNarcissus

replies.bodyText:
Sure! In previous implementation, only timeseries fullpath is written into mod file.
E.g. the deletion path is "root.sg.d1.*" and d1 has N measurements, we have to access mod file N times to record all the fullpaths.
For now, we record "root.sg.d1.*" into mod file only once.
replies.author: wshao08
qiaojialin

replies.bodyText:
That's what we expected.
For one delete time series, record one mod information for all mod files, but only one record per file.
replies.author: wshao08

timeline.bodyText: Have you finish the TODO?
timeline.author: SilverNarcissus

timeline.bodyText:
This may cause OOM, you'd better provide a match method for TsFileResource.
For each device in TsFileResource, check if it matches the given path
timeline.author: qiaojialin

timeline.bodyText: It seems that deleteTimeseries function can directly call the delete function to avoid code duplication.
timeline.author: JackieTien97

timeline.bodyText: Before, the modication record corresponds to only one timeseries, so it's safe to delete it while occuring one matched time series. However. now, one modification record could correspond to many timeseries, it won't be right to delete it.
timeline.author: JackieTien97

timeline.bodyText:
The if condition is wrong. Maybe you can change a way, think about when it will return true.Like:
!tsFileResource.containsDevice(deviceId) ||	      if (canSkipDelete(tsFileResource, deletion)) {
deletion.getEndTime() < tsFileResource.getStartTime(deviceId) ||
deletion.getStartTime() > tsFileResource.getOrDefaultEndTime(deviceId, Long.MAX_VALUE)
timeline.author: JackieTien97

timeline.bodyText: The canSkipDelete function will can the IoTDB.metaManager.getAllTimeseriesPath(deletion.getPath()), it shouldn't be in the for loop, and actually, you already have it in the caller of this function.
timeline.author: JackieTien97

timeline.bodyText: no need to call getAllTimeseriesPath again, you can pass it from the caller.
timeline.author: JackieTien97

timeline.bodyText: No need to get full path here.
timeline.author: JackieTien97

timeline.bodyText: Same as above.
timeline.author: JackieTien97

timeline.bodyText: It seems that you have get all the timeseries for each path here, there is no need for you to call it again somewhere else, you can pass it from here.
timeline.author: JackieTien97

timeline.message: Avoid invoking getAllTimeseriesPath() for performance's sake

timeline.bodyText: hi, why clear the deviceMap?   if originalPath is root.ln.sg and devicePath is root.ln.sg.d1, we only need to delete the points in time range [89, 100], but the memChunk maybe have points in time range [0, 100].  Same as the second condition which check  the last path is *.
timeline.author: mychaow

replies.bodyText: Oh, I forgot the delete range check. Fixed, thanks
